TopicTitle: KSP Mission Patches - FREE PSD DOWNLOAD

Articles.Content:
As I was about to reach 100+ hours of playtime on Kerbal Space Program, I thought it was time to celebrate and brag a little about my ingame achievement.

So I chose to make some mission patches for some missions that I did in KSP.

Obvious source of inspiration was NASA patches, but I also was inspired by the unofficial mission patch by James White.

(Full res images and other nice features on my behance : http://www.behance.net/gallery/Kerbal-Mission-Patches/13065333 )

I'm looking forward for your feedback, ideas, suggestions, etc...

Cheers from France,

Update 28 Jan 14 : I don't have much time anymore to fullfill so many request. And I'm sorry for that.

I think that the easiest way to continue to spread those patches is to offer a free link to the PSD file.

So, you just have to click on the link here : [see below] and you'll be able to download the file for the price of a tweet or a fb share. I think that's a pretty decent deal.

Don't forget to share your creations on this topic, really eager to see what you fellows are going to make out of the PSD

Cheers,

Update 17 Sep 14 : Sorry I haven't check this thread sooner. The PayWithATweet was broken, so here's a new one !

http://www.paywithatweet.com/pay?id=b24fc494-79d0-4f99-b6ba-5b456f0fe294

Cheers from MontrÃƒÂ©al, QC

Update with PSD
Really nice work! I like the mottos, and the mosaic patterns for the planets are an interesting touch.

Where are such beautiful and godly mission patches born?

They look awesome. Very NASA-like.
Nice! Do you take requests?

Thanks everyone for the feedback

@Commander Zoom : It's a stained glass design (not a mosaic). I wanted to display the planets in a unusual way

@Astropapi1 : I'm not sure i got your question figured :/ Can you rephrase it ?

@TheJediMaster : Some requests, I could take. But, pretty busy I am.
Any other feedbacks ?

Oh my gosh! These look godly, you should start some kind of thread where people can order these (that is if you like doing it). I really love these, looks so nasa real-life ish!

Any chance you could create one for the IEB (international eve base) ?

@Astropapi1 : I'm not sure i got your question figured :/ Can you rephrase it ?

I'm just kidding.

How much time does one of those take you to make? If I had a space program, you'd be my mission patch designer for sure.

Oh my gosh! These look godly, you should start some kind of thread where people can order these (that is if you like doing it). I really love these, looks so nasa real-life ish!

Any chance you could create one for the IEB (international eve base) ?

I can make one for EIB for sure yeah. Just give me more details (shape of the patch ? Names ? Motto ? Illustration ?) and I'll see what I can do

I'm just kidding.

How much time does one of those take you to make? If I had a space program, you'd be my mission patch designer for sure.

The first one was the longest to make, I'd say like 40 minutes. Then, I just adapted the thing so it's way faster

So circular shaped, no names since we have over 30 kerbals on the surface, moto: something like: a life for knowledge! (If you can come up with something better then that is fine aswell) and as illustration i would like a hitchhiker on landing leggs shaped thing placed on top of the eve sign. I this sufficient information? I'll thank you in advance for giving me the opurtunity to get something that awesome!

Hmmm. I don't have anything specific in mind, but if you'd be so kind as to glance over The Next Frontier (link's in my sig) and see what jumps out at you for the Starfarer 1 mission I'd be very grateful.

Wow, that's amazing! The only criticism I have is that the little floppy disk on the satellite seems a tad bit repetitious. Could you remove it please? Also, consider reducing the size of the satellite just a tiny bit so the solar panel isn't so close to the white part of the big floppy disk. Otherwise it's perfect. Nice work!

If you don't have time right now you could just PM me the file (I'm assuming you're using photoshop) and I could do it myself.

Here you go
